result.execSummary:
The defendant Sidney M Sheridan was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Controlled Substance, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Pail in full from bond on file.    Court advised defendant of the DNA submission requirement.
May apply for expungement if defendant has no new crimes charged in the next year.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Sidney M Sheridan

defendant.name: Sheridan, Sidney M
defendant.address: W1903 Dombek Road, Lyndon Station, WI 53944

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: of JOC

ADA Melissa Inlow appeared for the State.    Defendant appeared in person, in custody, with Attorney Fredrickson.  State moved to amend to 961.41(3g)(b).  Granted.  Defendant plead guilty. Count 2 dismissed, but read in for sentencing purposes. Court recited the charge and possible penalties of the count he is pleading to.    He understood.  Court reviewed the plea questionnaire, constitutional rights and elements with the defendant.  Defendant understood.  Defense stipulated that there is a factual basis for the plea.   Court found that the defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently entered his plea and waived his constitutional rights.  Court found that a factual basis exists for the plea.  Found guilty of amended Count 1.  Joint recommendation for 30 days, time served.  CC and DNA sample.  May apply to expunge if he commits no new crimes in the next year and pays court costs.  Defendant did not exercise his right to allocution.   Court ordered:  30 days, time served.  CC and DNA sample.  May apply to expunge if he no new crimes charge in the next year and pays court costs in full.  Pay CC @ $50.00/mo. starting 3/1.    Failure to pay any part of the fine or court costs in full by the due date will result in 1 day jail for each $25 left unpaid.
Plea/sentencing hearing at 02-01-2016 01:30 pm
ADA Melissa Inlow appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared through Attorney Fredrickson.  Have an agreement.  Plea/sentencing to be set.
In custody.

Not to possess or consume any controlled substances.   Not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Not to possess any prescription medications of any kind unless those have been prescribed to the defendant by a physician, and in that case, the defendant shall take such medications only as prescribed.  Defendant shall not alter the form of any prescription prior to, or in conjunction with, ingestion. Must reside with father at W1903 Dombek Road Lyndon Station WI

GAJ clerked. DA Gerald Fox appears for the State.  Defendant appeared by video from the jail, Attorney Fredrickson appeared in court.   Review of the cash bond.  Attorney Fredrickson requested $1000 signature bond.  Attorney Fox advised court that the defendant told the court he would not return to court.  Attorney Fredrickson said the defendant has had time to think and that the defendant did not lie about his name.  Attorney Fox read report.  DA Fox requested a modest cash bond.  Court lowed the cash bond to $100.
2 fingerprint cards

Defendant appeared by video from Jackson County Jail.  Melissa Inlow appears for the State.  Defendant states he has received the complaint.  The Court reviews the charges/penalties.  Defendant states he has spoken to the SPDO yesterday and he qualifies.  State requests a $500 cash bond with conditions.  Judge orders bond as requested by DA.  Set for adjourned initial appearance on 4-20-15 at 9:30.  Court instructs the defendant to contact the SPDO again.
